column5: Victim was inside a building bundling material and became ill, possible heat stroke.

Fatality at a bookstore under construction.

column5: Worker was spotting a mobile home. The home slipped off the jack onto the worker.

column5: The worker was confronted in the parking lot of Cider Mill. The worker ran into the barn, where shots were fired killing the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Underground Utilities Contractors, Inc., Cabot, AR 72023
column5: Worker was installing a 7620-volt power line and was electrocuted.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Cross Country Vans Inc., Bosque Farms, NM 87068
column5: The worker was found by another transport driver unconscious. Attempts to revive were unsuccessful.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Protection Service Inc., High Point, NC 27260
column5: The worker was clearing a traffic control work zone when he was struck by a vehicle in the closed lane.
Worker was cleaning poultry coops/bins and fell 18-20 feet off an extension ladder.
Decedent was working inside a mobile home, mixing propane and butane to make a substitute refrigerant. A fire occurred. The cause of death was determined to be carbon monoxide asphyxiation.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Dennis Powell Loggin, St. Maries, ID 83861
column5: Decedent was driving a log truck uphill to pick up a load of logs. The truck left the road and went 200 feet down a hill. Decedent was thrown for the truck.
Employees were installing roof trusses 20 feet from ground level, when 50 trusses fell in a domino effect crushing the employees. One employee fatality and to employees were hospitalized.

Preliminary Description of Incident: U E Power Train dba Bucks Engines, Amarillo, TX 79109
column5: Decedent was observed standing behind the parts counter, conscious but bleeding from the head.
Decedent fell 4-ft, 8-inches off a platform, striking his head.

Preliminary Description of Incident: St. Peter Catholic Church, Deland, FL 32720
column5: Decedent was cleaning the grout on the walls with a pressure washer, containing water, and was overexposed to carbon monoxide.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Tyson Foods - River Valley Animal Foods, Scranton, AR 72863
column5: Decedent was dumping a load of offal from a tractor trailer. He was in the process of dumping offal into a bin when the tailgate malfunctioned. Decedent was freeing the tailgate, it released, and the load swept the decedent into the offal bin. Decedent drowned in the bin.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Artistic Painting Company, Grand Praire, TX 75050
column5: Decedent was using a scaffold above 10 to 15 feet while painting. Instead of extending the scaffold, he used a step ladder on the scaffold, and feel off the scaffold.

The decedent returned from his break to his work area and was sitting when he fell over. He was transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead. It was determined the decedent died from natural causes.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Colorado Bell Hotel & Casino, Laughlin, NV 89028
column5: The decedent was not feeling well and left work early. While he was sitting waiting for the bus he collapsed and was non-responsive from an apparent heart attack. He was transported to the hospital where he was pronounced dead.

Preliminary Description of Incident: B & C Auto Inc., Davenport, IA 52806
column5: The decedent was removing a part from an elevated truck. The truck fell crushing the decedent.
Decedent was assisting in unloading material when he fell from the back of the truck, striking his head.
Employees were installing a tilt-wall into a trench. Decedent was inside the trench when the earth collapsed.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Nelson Brothers Construction Co., Eagle Mountain, UT 84005
column5: Decedent was operating a roller compactor on a grade. The compactor tipped over and fell on the decedent resulting in the decedent's death.
Decedent was walking across a tank and fell through a hatch into a tank of boiling water. He either drowned or died of thermal burns.
Decedent collapsed in the Macy's West store. CPR was performed. The decedent passed away at the hospital.
Decedent was unloading logs from truck in sawmill yard. While releasing straps one of the logs rolled onto the employee.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Randy's Pro Landscaping Service, LLC, Milburn, NJ 07041
column5: Decedent was trimming a tree and fell 60 feet to the ground.
Decedent was inside a silo loading the feeder from a ladder. He became wedged within the ladder cage in a fetal position and suffocated.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Escalera Maintenance Corporation, Las Vegas, NV 89123
column5: The worker was assigned to perform irrigation maintenance work in an apartment complex. The worker was asked by a couple moving for help moving furniture. While moving a piece of furniture, the worker got on the truck, fell to the ground and hit his head. The worker was taken to the hospital where he died 14 days later.
The worker was operating a pallet jack, when entering an intersection drove into the stairwell.
The worker was found behind the sales counter unconscious and unresponsive. The worker was pronounced dead at the scene by the coroner's office at 4:30pm.

Preliminary Description of Incident: International Shipping Agency, Inc., San Juan, PR 00902
column5: Worker was run over by an intermodal container.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Odyssey Painting, McKees Rocks Bridge, Pier 16, McKees Rocks, PA 15136
column5: Worker was sandblasting under a bridge and fell 124-feet from a two-point suspension scaffold.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Price Gregory Construction, W. Monroe, LA 71292
column5: Worker was inside the engine compartment of a backhoe changing the filters and was struck by the counter weight of another backhoe.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Y O Ranch Partnership, Mountain Home, TX 78058
column5: Worker was loading a wild barrsinghuas into a holding pen. The animal gored the decedent in the leg and back.
Worker was putting in metal studs and was found on the scissor lift.
Worker was found unresponsive in the employee restroom.
The worker was in route to the Bernalillo County Detention Center to dispense medication to inmates and was struck by another car on the I-40 Frontage Road.

Preliminary Description of Incident: T. A. Operating LLC dba Petro Lube Center, Jackson, MS 39201
column5: Worker was assigned to check out a semi-trailer's front right air bag. While positioned between the two trailer axles, he was struck on the head by the left front air bag's base cup.
Worker was performing work on a gas drilling rig and was struck in the chest by a drill pipe.
The worker was measuring the roadway as part of the painting process when struck by a vehicle.
Worker was carrying tools to the other side of a metal corrugated roof and fell 25-feet through one of the skylights.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Marine Fabrication and Repair, Houma, LA 70360
column5: Worker was performing welding duties aboard a marine vessel. An electrode from his welding equipment contacted the sweat on his neck, causing an electric shock.
Worker was electrocuted.
The worker was crushed under a 12-foot long, 3-inch diameter carpet roll.
Worker was trimming trees and was electrocuted, after the aerial lift contacted an overhead powerline, causing the bucket truck to become energized.
Worker was operating a line 2 extrusion machine and was struck by a plug at the end of the line.
Worker was cleaning the hardened plastic from the mold. He was standing in between the mold plates when the machine started and was crushed between the mold plates.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Fox and Hound English Pub and Grille, Parma, OH 44129
column5: Worker was cleaning a pizza oven and was found later, unresponsive in the break room.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Golden Strip Transfer, Inc., North Charleston, SC 29408
column5: Worker was locking down a shipping container to the bed of his truck and was struck by the rubber tire crane.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department, Las Vegas, NV 89101
column5: The worker was traveling in a patrol vehicle when the patrol vehicle left the road, struck a stationary object and rolled over. The worker was taken to the hospital where he later died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Pages Creek Marine Services, Inc., Wilmington, NC 28411
column5: The worker used a set of 2-ton underslung hoists to raise a boat on a trailer. The boat fell, crushing the worker between the boat and the left rear of the trailer.
Worker was washing flights on an auger of a concrete machine and was pulled into the flights of the auger.
Worker was under a home doing plumbing work in a tunnel, dug under the concrete foundation using an electrical shovel type drill, and was electrocuted.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Duckels Construciton Inc., Steamboat Springs, CO 80487
column5: Worker was struck by a pipe cap in the back.
Employees were splicing a de-energized downed oil field line. The oil field line got into a 7300-volt line, electrocuting one worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Rio Hotel and Casino, Las Vegas, NV 89103
column5: The worker complained of a headache and was transported to the hospital. The worker passed away from natural causes on September 24, 2009.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Rocky Mountain Roofing Company, Albuquerque, NM 87114
column5: The worker was installing metal coping at the roof edge when he lost his balance and fell tot he ground. The worker was hospitalized and died on October 9, 2009.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Cliff's Auto Service Center, Springtown, TX 76082
column5: Worker was changing a fluorescent overhead light and was electrocuted.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Hill Construction Corp., San Juan, PR 00908
column5: Worker fell 70-feet into a gap that was on the formwork while removing the excess plaster.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Masonry Preservation Group, Inc., Philadelphia, PA 19103
column5: Worker was in the cage of an aerial lift with the boom extended 95-feet when the lift tipped over, falling to the ground.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Reilly Construction Co. Inc., Ossian, IA
column5: The worker was replacing a pivot pin on the equalizer bar under a bulldozer. The bulldozer was supported with jack stands. The worker was under the bulldozer when it fell off the jack stands and crushed him.
Worker was carrying tiles on residential roof. He backed up into an overhead power line and was electrocuted.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Diamond Jacks Casino & Resort, Bossier City, LA 71111
column5: Worker was investigating a water leak in a public stairwell between the 1st and 2nd decks. He opened a secured door leading to the exterior of the boat and fell through.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Material Sciences Corporation, Elk Grove Village, IL 60007
column5: Worker was wrapping an 18,000-lb steel coil while the coil was on an exit coil cart. The steel coil came off from the cart and fall on the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Morgan Keller, Inc., Union Bridge, MD 21791
column5: Worker was crushed between a truck and a building.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Stamer, Inc. dba Fulton Plumbing, Heating, Air, Atlanta, GA
column5: Worker was working in an unprotected trench installing a sewer/water line. A portion of the trench caved in, fully engulfing the worker and trapping another employee, who was hospitalized.
Worker was in the process of installing traffic counts and was hit by a motor vehicle.
Worker was working on a skid steer machine and was pinned between the arms of the machine and the machine frame.
Worker was performing roofing work on a low slope roof and fell through an unprotected skylight.
Two workers were killed from a possible fall and/or oxygen deficiency while entering a permit-required confined space manhole.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Rose Hill Conference Center Nashville, NC  27856
column5: Worker was operating a small tractor that overturned and pinned him underneath.
Worker was operating an aerial lift and got caught between the lift and an overhead door's overhang.
Worker was operating his personal vehicle at a railroad crossing and was struck by a train.

Preliminary Description of Incident: (Company name not determined) Long Beach, CA 90603
column5: Fisherman was electrocuted on a boat at sea as he was changing a capacitor in a breaker box.  (U.S. Coast Guard is investigating.)
Worker was crushed by a section of steel plate.
Worker was lighting up a gas furnace.  An explosion occurred and the worker was struck on the head by falling debris.

Worker was measuring a grade for the bridge brackets, outside the life-line system, on the I-64 bridge when he fell approximately 30 feet to the ground below.  He was wearing a fall protection harness, but was not tied off.
Worker without fall protection was replacing sections of a roof.  He fell through a 40-inch opening in the roof and down 31 feet to the ground.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Roy Case Construction, Mountain Pine, AR 71956
column5: Worker was operating crane when crane tipped.  Worker fell and was crushed between crane cab and a wall.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Qualico Steel Company, Inc. , Webb, AL 36376
column5: While changing and wiring two heaters, worker turned on electricity to check wiring.  He forgot to turn off the electricity and was electrocuted by 480 volts upon contact.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Wright Brothers Construction Company,Inc., Charleston, TN 37304
column5: Worker lost control of an articulating dump truck at a landfill.  The truck flipped over, pinning the operator under the motor compartment.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Alliance Electric LLC, Harpers Ferry, WV 25425
column5: Worker was holding end of the hose while pouring concrete from pump truck.  Truck's boom contacted overhead line, electrocuting worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Grayco Construction Co. of TN, LLC, Conway, AR 72032
column5: Worker had parked a water tank truck on an incline.  While filling the truck's tank, the truck rolled down the incline and over the worker.
Worker was operating an earth roller that tipped and crushed him.
While worker was uncovering a sewer pipe with a shovel in a trench approximately 6 feet deep when the trench collapsed.

Two workers were plastering walls at an elevated height of 150-feet, a mast scaffold was used as a working platform. The scaffold platform became loose and fell to the ground, killing the two workers.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Flat Top Ranch LLC, 2521 Fishhook Park Road, Prescott, WA 99348
column5: The worker was attempting to hook up a tractor grader to a semi that lost traction while ascending a hill. The grader was parked in front of the semi. The grader lost brakes, rolled back crushing the worker between the grader and the semi truck.
Worker was doing repairs on the roof of apartments using a 24-foot aluminum extension ladder. He descended from the ladder, stepping on the first step and fell 20-22 feet.

Preliminary Description of Incident: All About Care Heating & Air Conditioning, Winston Salem, NC 27107
column5: The worker was working on the roof on a home when the worker fell through a hole in the roof and hit his head against the concrete floor of the basement. He was transported to the hospital where he was pronounced dead on October 9, 2009.

Preliminary Description of Incident: AAA Seattle Best Autobody Inc., Seattle, WA 98133
column5: The worker was removing a bumper from a wrecked SUV. The worker jacked up the rear of the SUV and was underneath removing the bumper when the jack collapsed pinning the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Town of Plainfield Polic Department, Plainfield, CT 06374
column5: The worker collapsed while responding to an aggressive dog call at a resident's address. The worker died 9 days later in the hospital.
The worker was working on dispatching merchandise and was pinned against the merchandise by the fork lift being driven by another employee.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Color Corporation of America, Louisville, KY 40210
column5: The worker collapsed while filling production barrels. The worker was transported to the hospital where he later died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: JSJ Tile & Stone, Inc., Bradenton, FL 34209
column5: Worker was struck by a pick-up truck that was backing up from a warehouse.
Worker fell off a boarding ramp to a docked tug and drowned.
Worker was unloading a D76 Dozer and was trapped by the dozer.

Worker was waiting in line to be loaded out at a mill. He had exited his truck to check on something on the trailer in front of him. While doing so the truck pull forward. The trailer tires struck and traveled over the worker.
The worker was run over by a trailer while harvesting onions.
Worker was using a hand-held grinder on floor bolts when sparks ignited flammable vapors in the area.

Preliminary Description of Incident: E & C Construction Oc., Newark, NJ 07104
column5: Worker fell 30-feet from a roof to the ground.
Worker was marking a roadway for striping operations and was struck by an automobile.
Worker was installing trimming and fell, hitting his head against the kitchen island.
Worker was doing construction operations and was struck by a road grader.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Dobson Brothers Construction Company, Lincoln, NE 68501
column5: During the interface between an asphalt paving machine and the asphalt truck, the rear tire of the truck exploded. The worker was struck be the exploding tire debris and release of pressure.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Hunter Maintenance & Leasing, Inc., Chicago, IL 60609
column5: Worker was replacing a hydraulic cylinder which raised the hopper of a street sweeping vehicle. The decedent had raised the hopper and was working within the framework, when the hopper dropped, crushing the worker between the hopper and the framework.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Sutherland Builders Inc., Penn Yan, NY 14527
column5: Worker was struck/crushed by walls and roof of a building after a dump truck fell onto the building.
Worker was working in the attic space of a residential home securing a ventilation line and fell through the attic floor.
Worker was holding the lid of a derrick truck while the derrick was being raised. The derrick contacted overhead power transmission lines and the worker was electrocuted.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Johnson Western Gunite Company, Kermit, WV 25674
column5: Worker was operating an excavator and was crushed after the wall collapsed on the excavator.

Preliminary Description of Incident: P & B Partitions, Inc., Verona, PA 15147
column5: Worker was in the process of moving a scissor lift using a lull to move it from floor to floor. Worker entered the scissor lift to drive it off the forks, a portion of the concrete plank landed on the worker, who was in the scissor lift.
Worker was working on a light fixture from a ladder 15-feet above the ground and fell, possible shock.
Worker was sruck by an object that fell from a shelving rack.

Preliminary Description of Incident: TD & I Cable Maintenance, Lakeland, MN 55043
column5: The worker was pulling cables or cutting cables and hit a 13,000 line and was electrocuted.
The worker was descending a ladder when suddenly he collapsed to the ground. CPR was administered but the worker's heart did not respond. The coroner ruled out the fall as a cause of death.
Worker was dismantling a 40-foot high scaffold and fell.
Worker was unloading bulls from a truck into the chute. One bull kicked the gate, knocking the worker over, hitting his head on the concrete. There was traumatic head injury with brain swelling.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Gulf Stream Marine Inc., Brownsville, TX 78526
column5: Worker was unloading a vessel and was struck by a loose spinning cargo sling chain.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Insituform Technologies, Inc., West Hartford, CT 06107
column5: Worker was crossing a street to get to a work zone and was struck by a motor vehicle.

Worker was operating a skid-steer cleaning out a dairy cattle barn near an outdoor manure slurry pit. The skid-steer and the worker fell off the end of the push-off platform into the manure slurry pit, trapping the worker in the vehicle. Worker died of suffocation due to inhalation of manure.
The worker had shortness of breath upon arriving at work. The worker was taken to the ER and went into cardiac arrest and died. The cause of death was cardiac arrest or pulmonary embolism.
The worker was driving to Duckwater. The left front tire on the concrete blew out, which caused the truck to flip killing the worker.
The worker was trapped in a large auger attached to a grain silo.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Pike Electric, Inc., Mount Airy, NC 28719
column5: The worker was performing maintenance on a power line when he was electrocuted.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Linde Material Handling North America Corporation, Summerville, SC 29483
column5: A forklift mast fell on the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: A-Core Concrete Cutting Inc., Salt Lake City, UT 84111
column5: The worker completed jack hammering a small section of concrete when a vehicle on the freeway went through the work site barricades, struck the worker, dragging him before striking a concrete barrier. The driver fled the scene killing the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Cemeterio Mayaguez Memorial, Inc., Mayaguez PR 00681
column5: The worker was moving and cutting marble and granite covers. While the worker was working on one cover, it fell on the worker killing him and injuring another employee and the owner.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Insulation Maintenance & Contracting, LLC, North Las Vegas NV 89030
column5: The worker was insulating pipes from a scissor lift, when co-workers noticed the worker collapsed and unresponsive. The worker was transported to the hospital where he was pronounced dead.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Twin City Fan Companies, Ltd., Pulaski, TN 38478 (Accident NC)
column5: The worker was working in a confined space fixing the motor to a fan. At 4:30 the worker collapsed while inside the confined space. Worker was taken to the hospital where the doctors say the brain activity has deteriorated and will probably not come back around. Worker is not deceased at this time.

Worker was working alone replacing gutters, louver and other work prior to painting. The worker fell from a step ladder onto flat roof. The worker did not seek any medical attention at the time. The worker was found unresponsive that same night.
The worker was cutting the limbs of a felled tree. A tree being cut struck the worker.
Worker was working from a mechanical mezzanine and fell 14-feet through a hole in the floor to the lower level.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Myers Contracting Company, New Carrollton, MD
column5: The worker fell of of roof.
The worker was shot multiple times in the head, neck and shoulder.

Preliminary Description of Incident: United Parcel Service, Inc., Lousville KY 40213
column5: While on lunch the worker suffered an asthma attack. The worker was taken to the hospital but did not survive.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Crowley-Sheppard Asphalt Co. Inc., Chicago Ridge, IL 60415
column5: Worker was flagging traffic in a road construction zone and was struck by a truck.
Worker was walking down steps from a utility room when he slipped or tripped.

Preliminary Description of Incident: BS Truckline, Inc., 4080 East Lake Mead Blvd., Las Vegas, NV 89115
column5: The worker was travelling on a highway and his vehicle swerved off the highway, went airborne and hit an embankment causing the worker to sustain fatal injuries.
Worker was delivering a fiberglass tank. He was retracting the knuckle boom on the crane back to travel position. The boom contracted a power line. Worker suffered injuries from electric shock.
Worker was on an aluminum extension ladder that had been extended 30-feet cutting limbs from a tree, lost his balance and fell.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Owensby & Kritkos, Inc., St. James, LA 70086
column5: Worker was working from scaffolding platform, while setting a ladder, lost his balance and fell through a 1-foot opening between the work platform and guardrail systems, 30-feet to the ground level.
Worker was performing maintenance on a tank area within the dry docked barge and upon exiting the area complained of experiencing breathing difficulties.
Worker was using a ladder to change a light bulb and fell from the ladder to the ground.

Preliminary Description of Incident: CHS Inc., Inver Grove Heights, MN 55077
column5: After unloading truck, worker went to next bay and struck a few vehicles and the building across from the delivery site.

Preliminary Description of Incident: US Aqua Vac, Inc., Deerfield, IL 60015
column5: Worker was diving under water cleaning a pond and drowned.

Preliminary Description of Incident: WL Construction, Inc., Western Springs, IL 60558
column5: Worker was placing a stepladder over a stairwell to retrieve wood from a job built scaffold. Worker was standing on the ladder when the ladder shifted and fell 14-feet into the concrete stairwell.
Worker was setting steel beam in house foundation and making adjustments to level the beam. The beam dislodged from its support and fell onto the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Penns Woods Tree Company, Allentown, PA 18109
column5: Workers were removing a tree by cutting the trunk into sections from an aerial bucket truck. The log was dropped 15 to 20-feet from the bucket, the worker operating the chipper had not cleared below and the log struck him on the head.

Preliminary Description of Incident: IHP Industrial, Inc., St. Joseph, MO 64503
column5: Worker was found on top of an air conditioning unit on a roof.
Worker fell 50-feet out of an Aerial Work Platform.
Worker was performing roadway repair and was struck by a vehicle.

Preliminary Description of Incident: William E. Lewis Logging, Inc., Greenville, NC 27834
column5: Worker was struck in the head by the top of a dead tree that was falling.
Worker was crushed by steam roller.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Randy Wagers dba R & B Roofing, Hyden, KY 47162
column5: The worker fell from the scaffold after being electrocuted. The worker died at the hospital while receiving treatment.

Worker was in the process of removing a box that contained a bicycle from a storage rack. He was standing on the second or third step of a step ladder. The box fell forward and he fell from the ladder, striking his head on the floor.
Worker was riding on a golf cart, stood up and fell, hitting his head.
Worker was backed over by bucket truck.

Preliminary Description of Incident: New Castle Hauling LLC, Foster, KY 41043
column5: The worker was operating a skidder during a logging operation when the skidder turned over. There were no witnesses. The worker was pinned under the skidder. Emergency services arrived and was pronounced dead.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Roger Schartz & Sons, Inc., Rose Creek, MN 55970
column5: Worker fell from top of truck and later died 11/8/2009.
Worker was looking up at a box performing work activities and passed out, hitting his head.
Two workers were checking tensioning on cables for a cable guardrail along the intestate when a pick-up truck pulling a trailer lost control and crossed the median striking both workers.

The worker collapsed in the dairy areas and was found unconscious and unresponsive by an employee. The worker was transported to the hospital where he was pronounced dead from an apparent heart attack.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Midwest Steel, Inc., Kansas CIty, MO 64108
column5: Worker was elevated in an aerial lift that collapsed.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Egenolf dba Horner Industrial Services, Indianapolis, IN 46225
column5: Worker was working alone and found by other employees having either fallen into or been inadvertently crushed by a moving part on a piece of equipment.
Worker was removing a tarp from his pickup truck and was struck by a wheel end loader, crushing him.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Garden City Coop, Inc., Dighton, KS 67839
column5: Worker was performing duty in a grain bin and was engulfed by grain.
Worker was found caught up in a roll up machine that tolls up fiberglass insulation.

Worker was engaged in work activities including rough terrain forklift operations and construction work and was walking up an incline away from the Lull carrying a screw gun box and was struck by the right rear tire of the Lull.
Worker was deep in a trench wrapping fence wire around the roots of an oak tree being transplanted. The wire broke and he was caught in a cave-in.
Worker was re-roofing a home and while walking on the ridge of the roof, he slipped, falling to the deck below.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Canagra Food Inc. dba Conagra Snack Foods Division, Garner, NC 27529
column5: An explosion and collapse of the building structure resulted in 4 worker deaths with the fourth succumbing to his injuries 11/19/2009.
The worker was repairing a skylight on the roof. He fell through the skylight area to the concrete pad. The worker died on the scene.
Worker fell through open catwalk.
Worker was christmas treeing three roof opening frames and the frame at the bottom of the rigging came off the hook, striking the worker.
Worker contracted H1N1 flu.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Opportunity VIllage, ARC, Las Vegas, NV 89146
column5: The worker was working inside a rental car office. Worker was found unconscious by a customer near the office counter. He was transported to the hospital where he later died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Big Lade Planting, Belle Glade, FL 33430
column5: Worker was driving a tractor pulling wagons in sugarcane harvesting, went off the road into a canal, drowning.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Bon Harbor Shell Station, Owensboro, KY
column5: Worker was fatally shot during the commission of a robbery.

Preliminary Description of Incident: John COllier Logging, Inc., Filmore, IN 46128
column5: Working at a private residence curring down trees, the worker was struck b a limb in the head and died.
Worker was in the process of removing a boom from a crane and knocked out 2 bottom pins from the heel section. The heel section came down, striking the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Bristol Tennessee Essential Services, Bristol, TN 37620
column5: The worker was climbing a utility pole to perform routine maintenance work and came into contact with a high voltage line.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Cactus Drilling, LLC, Elk City, OK 73644
column5: Workers (2) were struck by a load being raised by a crane when rigging spreader came loose.
Worker was crushed by an automobile that was rolling backwards.

Preliminary Description of Incident: JJ Concrete, Inc., North Sioux CIty, SD 57049
column5: Worker was setting foundation forms. An excavated dirt wall caved in, burying and crushing him.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Moreau's Material Yard, Des Allemandes, LA 70030
column5: Worker was riding a lead system when the crawler crane tipped over causing him to be thrown from a platform, striking the boom of the crane.
Worker was trapped and crushed by a concrete pallet.
Worker was caulking an AC unit and fell off the balcony.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Brown Transport, Inc., West Alexandria, OH 45381
column5: Worker was dumping waste from papermill site that is being torn down, when dump trailer made contact with power lines. The worker exited the truck cab and was electrocuted.
Worker was in a nearby workshop when the boom of a 200-ton crane collapsed into the workshop fatally injuring the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Pro Medica Health Systems, Toledo, OH 43606
column5: Worker was struck by a van that was backing in.
The worker was removing a starter part. It slipped off the mandrill and fell onto the worker killing him.
Worker was unloading pipe and was crushed between the pipe and front end loader.
Worker was transferring granite slabs and a slab fell, crushing the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: West Selden Construction, Incorporated, Boston, MA 02122
column5: Worker was in the process of climbing the frames of a scaffold to get to his work station and collapsed, falling 25-feet from the platform to the ground below.
Worker was standing along side his semi-trailer, as it was being unloaded by a powered industrial truck. A bundle of steel weighing 2700-pounds fell, striking him.
Worker was part of a land based oil rig & natural gas well drilling rig crew and contracted the H1N1 flu.
Worker was operating an order picker and struck a rack, which pushed a pallet of glass onto the order picker.
Worker was working the drilling board. A drill pipe came loose striking the worker on the head.
Workers were using a thinner product to prepare the inner section of the bottom hull for painting. There was a fire/explosion killing two workers and hospitalizing two other workers.

Preliminary Description of Incident: NYSDOT Alder Creek Sub Residency, Alder Creek, NY 13301
column5: A New York State Department of Transportation Highway Maintenance worker, while working as a flagman in a work zone was struck b a motor vehicle.
Worker was in the process of installing a wireless point at a facility. He was using a 6-ft ladder to access the ceiling, fell backwards off the ladder, striking his head on the concrete floor.
Worker was crushed between a forklift and a parked flatbed truck.
The worker, a custodial supervisor, was found dead.
Worker was performing detail work on a vehicle and ingested a wheel cleaning solution.
Worker fell off orchard picker ladder as he was ascending with an empty orange pickers bag.

column5: Worker was working at 2:47 a.m. in a convenience store, when he was shot during a robbery attempt. He was taken off life support on 1/27/2010.

column5: Workers were coating the interior of a trailer tank; fumes ignited from the trailer tank, causing a flash fire. One worker fatality and two workers were hospitalized.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Cargill Meat Solutions, Nebraska City, NE 68410
column5: Worker was disassembling storage racks from inside a scissor lift elevated 20 feet and attaching a strap to the rack and slowly leaning it over. The strap caught the lift and tipped over with the rack.
Worker was standing on a ladder with a chain saw to cut a tree trunk. The chain saw apparently struck the victim 's neck.
Worker either fell from ladder or roof.
A professor was assaulted while providing mentoring services in an assigned office space. Event occurred during normal office hours. Multiple stab injuries to abdomen and torso.
Worker of New York City Housing Authority was found dead at his work station in the boiler room. (Inspection planned)
Skull fracture.
Worker was unloading a trailer, and a box fell on him.

Preliminary Description of Incident: NYS Police Troop C, Morris, NY
column5: Trooper collided with a westbound tractor trailer.

Preliminary Description of Incident: NYC Department of Sanitation - Queens West 1, Astoria, NY 11106
column5: Worker was killed after being pinned between a tractor trailer and his garbage truck.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Capital Trading LLC, West Jordan, UT 84088
column5: Worker was crushed between a delivery truck and the loading dock resulting in serious injuries and his death.
Worker was struck by a steel shaft being worked on in a lathe.
Worker was run over by a forklift on a construction site and fatally injured.
Worker was in the process of unloading a truck when the forklift he was operating overturned.
A car being driven off of the exit-end of the car wash conveyor to the drying area outside of the building accelerated suddenly, striking the worker standing near the auto door to the outside.
Worker was found at the log loading site beneath the front right tire of a skidder.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Manheim's San Francisco Bay Auto Auction, Hayward, CA 94544
column5: Worker was found lying dead on roadway adjacent to work. Apparent homicide.
Worker was inflating a tire that exploded, striking him
Worker was assisting in the delivery of granite slabs using a forklift.  The forklift hit two slabs that fell, striking the worker on the head.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Apac Southeast, Inc., Winter Haven, FL  33884
column5: Worker was in the process of putting equipment on a machine and was found on the ground by other workers; apparent heart attack.

Preliminary Description of Incident: P.A.M. Transport, Inc., North Jackson, OH  44451
column5: Worker was found unresponsive after pulling a tractor trailer into the shop building.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Palatka Welding Shop Inc., Palm Coast, FL  32164
column5: Worker was installing metal roofing and fell 35 feet, hitting the concrete floor.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Long Foundation Drilling Co., Cullman, AL  35057
column5: Worker was lowered into a 30- to 35-foot deep shaft to perform hand cleaning and to drill a sample test of a rock.  He was being lifted out of the shaft by the use of a pneumatic winch system.  The winch system collapsed into the shaft, striking the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Schneider National Carriers, Green Bay, WI  54313
column5: Worker was adjusting the wheel location of a trailer and was run over by the trailer of the truck.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Breeze National Inc., New York, NY  10027
column5: Worker fell from scaffold into a window opening and 20 feet down an elevator shaft.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Green Circle Bio Energy, Inc., Cottondale, FL  32431
column5: Worker received severe steam burns to his lungs during the clinker material clearing process.
Worker was disassembling a communication tower and fell 98 feet to the ground.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Mercy Medical Center, Mason City, IA 50401

Preliminary Description of Incident: Delta Air Lines Inc., Seattle, WA 91858
column5: Worker was operating a tug vehicle that transfers luggage from terminals to airplanes. The tug collided with a food service truck. The worker was ejected from the tug and struck his head on the pavement. He was transferred to the hospital where he later died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Borinquen Metal Scrap Corp., Gurabo, PR 00778
column5: While working on a metal roof, the aluminum metal sheet, which was deteriorated, broke. The worker fell to the ground, later dying at the hospital.
Workers were painting a newly constructed sludge pit. Worker turned to find other worker slumped down by the wall.
Workers were doing a "blow down" to clear gas from the lines and an explosion occurred.  One worker fatality.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Instrument Sciences and Technology, Middletown, CT  06457
column5: Workers were doing a "blow down" to clear gas from the lines and an explosion occurred.  One worker fatality.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Julies Café LLC, Green Bay, WI  54301
column5: Worker slipped at work, fracturing ankle.  Worker died of blood clots two days later.
Workers were doing a "blow down" to clear gas from the lines and an explosion occurred.  There were three fatalities.
Worker was caught between the back of a semi-trailer and a loading dock. He was transported to the hospital where he later died.
Worker was shot by an unknown assailant in the parking lot and was hospitalized; shooter then committed suicide.

Preliminary Description of Incident: East Alabama Paving Company, Inc., Opelika, AL  36804
column5: Worker was struck by a dump truck.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Matuia & Matuia Construction, Inc., Lake Jackson, TX  77566
column5: Worker entered a manhole in an abandoned sewer line to remove a cap from a vent line and fell 7to 10 feet from a ladder.
Workers were working under the chassis of a water pump that was up on four jack stands.  One of the jacks was removed and the water pump came down, crushing the worker.
Worker was dipping a metal part into a heated bath and an explosion occurred, burning worker.
Excavator broke through ice coming to rest on its side and entrapping worker underwater.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Time Warner Cable, Wichita Falls, TX  76306
column5: Worker fell out of bucket truck after his truck was struck by another vehicle.
Worker suffered heart attack and died while sweeping water from the roof of an apartment building. (Inspection planned)

Preliminary Description of Incident: Volunteers of America of Ohio, Cleveland, OH  44110
column5: Worker was assaulted by a homeless veteran.

Preliminary Description of Incident: D&S Tree Service, Inc., Marion IL  62959
column5: Worker was using a wood chipper to process branches from a tree trimming job.  The chipper discharge chute clogged up and the worker removed the pin that held the access panel down over the cutterwheel.  The cutterwheel was still rotating and discharged wood material against the access panel, which flipped open and the worker was hit in the face and forehead with the handle of the access panel.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Batzli Excavating Company Inc., East Rochester, OH  44625
column5: Worker was emptying rock salt out of the back of his dump truck with a spreader.  His arm was caught in the rotating auger distribution system.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Uptowner Inns Inc. dba Holiday Inn Hotel and Suite, Huntington, WV  25701
column5: Worker was exposed to a chemical stripping agent and suffered respiratory pain / illness due to poor ventilation.

Preliminary Description of Incident: KAL Services, Inc. dba Midwest Sanitation, Oskaloosa, IA 52577
column5: Worker was trying to grab a large piece of cardboard out of the back of the garbage truck when the driver began to close the tailgate. The driver heard the worker and opened it. The worker who had been caught by the tailgate was transported to the hospital where he later died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Carr & Sons, Masonry, Inc., Clearwater, FL  33767
column5: Worker was working on a column and fell over safety rail from the second level.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Suburban Tire Company, St. Charles, IL  60174
column5: Worker was crushed between the ground and the arm of an automotive lift.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Galland Henning Nopak, Inc., West Milwaukee, WI  53215

Worker was attempting to tie into a main water line that was 17 to 20 feet underground when the trench collapsed.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Southland Steel Fabricators, Baton Rouge, LA  70816
column5: Worker was working from a manlift connecting a beam.  The beam being held by a crane, shifted and hit the manlift knocking the worker from the manlift, 14 to16 feet to the ground.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Duncan Oil Co., South Charleston, OH  45368
column5: Worker was refilling aboveground fuel oil tanks from a tank truck.  He had walked behind the truck and bent over, his coat was caught in the power take-off.
Worker, a machine operator, was using a grinding machine and the grinding wheel on the machine broke into pieces. One piece of the wheel struck the worker in the face. The worker died instantly.
Worker was draining a tank; one of the employees climbed to the top of the tank and lit a cigarette and waved it over the opening in the tank.  The tank exploded, killing the worker.
Worker found unconscious in a hog barn.

Preliminary Description of Incident: The Clarion Hotel & Conference Center, Shepherdstown, WV  25443
column5: Worker was working in the kitchen area and fainted / fell to the floor, grabbing hold of a deep fryer, spilling hot grease out onto her and burning 30 percent of her body.
Worker was removing an antenna from a hangar roof.  He was walking a beam and stepped off and fell through the roof of the hangar.
Worker was struck by a powered industrial truck that was loading paper bales into a semi-trailer.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Mountain State Carbon, LLC, Follansbee, WV  26037
column5: Worker was traveling underneath a coal transfer belt.  A large icicle broke away from the belt structure and fell onto the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Hansell Mitzel Homes LLC, Mt. Vernon, WA 98273
column5: Worker was crushed by the bulldozer he was operating. He was transported to the hospital where he later died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Severstal Sparrows Point, LLC, Sparrows Point, MD 21219
column5: Worker was descending from the cab/platform built into the side of the vehicle. The worker fell backwards and landed on the concrete floor.
Worker was bitten by a customer's dog at a gated storage facility while on duty. Worker passed away two days later at the hospital from blood poisoning related to the dog bite.

Preliminary Description of Incident: A to Z Island Maintenance, Inc., Chinquapin, NC 28521
column5: Six workers were installing bracing to trusses while working on/inside the web of the trusses with two workers on the ground. The trusses collapsed/rolled. Two workers fell from the trusses and were injured. One worker, the ground man, was cutting lumber to length. He was killed when the trusses fell on him.
Worker was moving hay out of a barn from a height of 10 to 12 feet. He fell and received head trauma, from which he died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Lewis Tree Service, Inc., Troy, NC 27371
column5: Worker was struck on the head by a tree limb while felling a tree.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Peninsula Packaging Co., LLC, Wilson, NC 27893
column5: Worker was performing maintenance on an extruder machine. He was discovered caught in the machine by the plant manager. He was pronounced dead at the scene.

Preliminary Description of Incident: State of MD Department of Juvenile Services/Chettenham
column5: Worker was murdered.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Celina Aluminum Precision Technology, Inc., Celina, OH  45822
column5: Worker was troubleshooting a Makino, multi-axis, computer numerical controlled (CNC) machine; the machine activated and the worker's head was impaled by the tooling spindle.
Worker was climbing a tower at a height of 58 feet and began having convulsions.

Preliminary Description of Incident: City of Chicago Police Department, Chicago, IL 60653
column5: Police officer was involved in a vehicle accident with a marked car. Apparently he struck a pole and tree and was pronounced dead at the hospital.

Preliminary Description of Incident: County of Cleveland - Self-McNeilly Solid Waste Management Facility, Shelby, NC 28150
column5: Worker was working as a landfill spotter. He was behind a CAT 836G compactor and the operator of the compactor did not see him. The operator of the compactor backed over the worker. He was taken to the hospital where he later died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: George J. Roll & Sons, Inc., Blue Island, IL  60406
column5: Worker was attempting to find the problem of a hydraulic flatbed truck.  He rose up the flatbed and positioned himself beneath the raised flatbed and the frame.  The hydraulics gave way and the worker was crushed.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Ricklefs Excavating LTD, Cedar Rapids, IA 52404

The pipe came out of the pipe clamp resulting in the pipe falling onto the worker's chest which caused a fatal crushing injury.

Worker was in the process of unloading pipe from a trailer.  He was removing a chain that was routed through the middle of the front weigh bridge, when the pipe rolled off the top of the load, striking the worker in the upper extremities knocking him down on the ground.

Preliminary Description of Incident: B K D Construction Inc., Juana Diaz, PR 00795
column5: While operating a boom truck attempting to move a junked truck, suddenly the boom broke from its base and stuck the worker causing a serious chest injury. The worker was killed.
Worker, acting as a spotter, was struck by the garbage truck that was backing up.
Worker was working on a step ladder adjusting a pipe on top of the pasting machine and fell backwards off of the ladder, hitting his head on the metal plate floor.
Worker, an animal trainer, was attacked by a killer whale in an aquarium's exhibition tank.
Worker had exited the cab of a truck.  Worker ran across the street to collect garbage and was hit by a vehicle.

Worker of a structural steel erection crew that was installing roof decking fell from the deck under construction to the concrete floor below. Worker was transported to the hospital where he later died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Rainaway Rain Control, Inc., Miami, FL  33126
column5: Worker was doing a job on a 6-foot ladder, lost his balance and fell, striking his head.
Worker tripped on an extension cord and fell onto a tiled floor in the deli. She was transported to the hospital where she later died.
Worker caught by the garbage truck compactor.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Township of Murphysboro - Public Works, Murphysboro, IL 62966
column5: Garage worker was found pinned by a vehicle at 6:45 a.m. The vehicle was still in drive and he had been pinned for a undetermined amount of time. He was taken to the hospital for treatment where he died later.
Worker was returning from the rest room and collapsed.
Teacher was shot multiple times as she entered the workplace.

Bakery worker, was using a home-made elevator to hoist material from the first level to the second level on a two story building. Upon entering  the elevator at the second floor, the chain sling supporting the elevator failed. The elevator in free fall caught the employee in/between the floor edge. He was found dead by a fellow worker.
Worker fell in a sewage pit.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Cooper T. Smith Stevedoring Co., Inc., Houston, TX  77014
column5: Worker had climbed a ladder to watch his gang.  A rolling crane was approaching his location and he did not see the second crane coming.  The walkway of the crane struck him off the ladder onto the ship's main deck. He was then caught by a piece of pipe and dragged until the crane was stopped.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Coastal Chemical Co. LLC, Beaumont, TX  77705
column5: Worker was struck by a 500-gallon tank that fell off the tines of a forklift.

Four insulation contractors were installing insulation on top of a new crude storage tank. The tank had been filled with water during recent hydrostatic testing. The workers were completing construction. Workers were welding when a fire ignited. Two fell from the tank, sustaining injuries, and were hospitalized. A third worker remained on top of the tank and was fatally burned. Fourth worker remains missing and is presumed dead.
Worker pressure washing a freezer via gasoline-powered washer was overcome by carbon monoxide.
Worker was drilling a water well.  The boom of the drilling rig contacted a high voltage power line of a cell phone tower.  Worker was electrocuted.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Fikes Truck Lines LLC, Houston, TX  77041
column5: Worker was in the process of removing synthetic straps from a load of four, 7-inch by 50-foot long, metal utility poles, when one of the poles, stacked on top, fell and landed on top of him.

Preliminary Description of Incident: M & L Services Co, Junction City, KS  66441
column5: Worker was flushing a refrigerator line and did not extinguish the pilot light on the water heater.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Peoples Gas Light and Coke Company, Chicago, IL  60606
column5: Two workers were conducting a pressure test on a pipe located in a timber-shored trench.  The workers were pressurizing the pipe to the desired amount.  The pipe burst and the pressure of the air forced the pipe and the timber shoring toward the workers.  One worker fatality and one worker hospitalization.
Worker was working in a pressure wash bay, cleaning some open-ended pipe, and was found collapsed on the concrete floor.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Contract Transportation Systems Inc, Oakridge, OR 97463
column5: Worker was driving a commercial truck and collided with several large bales of hay that fell off an unknown semi-trailer.

Preliminary Description of Incident: DE Best Plumbing, Inc., Columbus, GA  31901
column5: Worker was making preparations to stack steel beams in a storage area; an I-beam fell from a mansport truck, striking the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Finger Lakes Service Group, Rochester, NY  14607
column5: Worker was using a "Better Spreader" to apply glue to the rubber membrane, walking backwards.  He backed off the roof and fell 27 feet to the ground below.
Worker was installing lamp/bulbs while in an elevated bucket on a truck and contacted a live wire, receiving a lethal shock.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Erickson Contract Surveying, Inc., Beach, ND  58621
column5: Worker was conducting seismographic drilling operations. Worker was tipping pipe out of the hole; the pipe came loose, and fell on the worker.
Worker was working inside a trench without a protective system; the trench walls collapsed.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Tyson Refrigerated Processed Meats, Inc., Houston, TX  72762
column5: Worker was working on the electrical wiring for overhead fluorescent lights in the attic of a plant, and was electrocuted.

Preliminary Description of Incident: U.S. Marine Corps, Marine Corps Community Service, Jacksonville , NC  28540
column5: Worker had taken a flat bottom boat out for a ride to put 10 hours of usage on the new motor.  Worker fell from the moving boat and his body was found later, floating.
Worker was killed when he overturned his side dump truck and struck a parked water truck.
A material handler was walking in a parking lot when he slipped on some ice causing him to fall, striking his head on parking lot surface.
Worker was working beneath a trailer when the jack stand broke.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Valor Technologies, Inc., Mt. Prospect, IL  60058
column5: Worker was disposing waste parquet flooring and tile from a gondola plastic cart into a dumpster.  Worker collapsed into the dumpster; apparent heart attack.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Dave Shaw Concrete & Block Inc., Hermosa Beach, CA 90254
column5: Worker was standing on platform/plywood on forklift and fell into a 15-foot excavation which collapsed around him, burying him.
Worker was struck by falling windmill blades when he went to start equipment.

Preliminary Description of Incident: AEE Tecnica de Rio Piedras, Santurce, PR 00908
column5: Worker was hit in the forehead by the hook of a crane that was being used to install a utility pole. He was knocked unconscious and transported to the hospital where he later died.

Worker had climbed down a ladder into a railcar, which had been identified as a confined space, wearing an acid gas respirator with an organic vapor cartridge.  As he began to exit the railcar, climbing up the ladder, he collapsed and fell back into the railcar.  It is believed there was a nitrogen atmosphere in the railcar.

Preliminary Description of Incident: North Star Emergency Services, LLC, Charlotte, NC 28277
column5: Worker was inspecting a roof on 2/23/2010 when he fell 23 feet. He later died from his injuries on 3/10/2010.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Florida Rock & Tank Lines Inc, Nashville, TN 37209
column5: Worker was using a power take-off (PTO) pump to transfer gasoline from one underground storage tank to another. The output pipe of the pump broke, spraying fuel over the worker. The fuel later ignited and the worker was seriously burned. He died the next day.

The company was applying a coat of stain and two coats of sealant.  Two workers were observed outside the building getting air, as the fumes were getting to be too much. One worker fatality and one worker hospitalization.

Preliminary Description of Incident: AEE Tecnica de Aguadilla, Moca, PR 00676
column5: Worker was repairing damage to a 4160-Volt power line. The worker grabbed the part of the line which was not de-energized and was electrocuted, instantly causing his death.
Worker was conducting roofing work, removing sky lights, and fell 50 feet to the lower level.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Clinton Hill Golf Course, Swansea, IL  62229
column5: Worker was spraying fertilizer with a utility cart boom sprayer.  The cart overturned trapping the worker.
Worker was working on highway with two other Walsh Construction workers and a subcontractor patching potholes. He was struck by a drunk driver speeding at up to 90 mph.
Worker was killed during a store robbery.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Demolition Disposal Services Inc., Lexington, KY 40509
column5: Two workers were at the Lexington landfill loading one dumpster into another. During the process a chain became hung up and one worker stepped into the dumpster to free the chain. The dumpster fell on the worker. He was transported to the hospital where he later died.
Worker attempted to break a grain bridge manually by entering the bin and fell into the grain.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Pacific Gas & Electric Co., Bencia, CA 94510
column5: Worker was working in a vault and was electrocuted.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Precision AG Service, Inc., Pocahontas, AR  72455
column5: Worker was in the process of transferring grain from one bin to another, and was found in a grain bin covered by a few feet of corn, 20 to 25 feet away from the door.

Worker was standing on a flatbed trailer while a crane operator was loading three coils of steel onto the truck. The coils fell off the truck striking the worker who had jumped off the truck to get out of the way.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Cal-Sierra Pipe Inc., La Grand, CA 95333
column5: Worker was unloading pipe from a flatbed trailer when he was knocked off the trailer by pipe that then fell onto him.
Worker was working on a large RV vehicle with the front suspended on a jack.  The jack collapsed, and the vehicle fell on the worker.
Worker was carrying an oxygen/acetylene hose.  Worker was walking uphill across a roadway and was struck by an end loader.
Worker was directing the driver of an 18-wheeler truck backwards into a Poly A Unit.  Worker ended up in a position where the 18-wheeler tires rolled over and crushed his head.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Pine Island Ridge Country Club, Davis, FL  33324
column5: Worker was driving a golf cart, picking up debris along the roadway, and was struck by a vehicle.

Worker was working on the airbrakes of the cab of a tractor trailer.  The truck engine engaged and dragged the worker until the truck hit another building.  Worker was found pinned between the left front tire and engine.
Worker was accessing the area under a load and was crushed/struck-by the scrap vehicle.

Worker was working on the wheel and axle line, using an overhead bridge crane to lift a 5,100-lb locomotive wheel set.  Worker lifted the locomotive wheel set, causing it to swing in a pendulum motion, pinning his leg against another stationary locomotive wheel set.
Worker became entangled in the rear differential of a vehicle.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Simpson Bridge Company Inc., Clevland, TN 37311
column5: Worker fell about 7 feet while pouring a concrete column for a new bridge. He was taken to the hospital where he died during back surgery.
Worker fell 25 feet off a manlift.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Bottom Dollar Tree Service, New Port Richey, FL  34654
column5: Worker was cutting tree branches and cut himself with a chainsaw.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Hidden Mill Marina Center, Egg Harbor Twp., NJ  08234
column5: Worker was working on a client's boat, and an explosion occurred.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Southern Pump and Tank Company, Charlotte, NC 28629
column5: Worker was working under a pull-behind compressor/generator and it fell off the jack stands.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Triple S Oilfield Construction, Odessa, TX  79766
column5: Worker received a severe electrical shock after an overhead crane derailed in the facility he was working in.

Preliminary Description of Incident: T.J.B. Logistics, LLC., Mountain Lakes, NJ  07046
column5: Worker fell off of an unguarded stair landing and struck his head on edge of stair tread 10 feet below.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Columbia Forest Productions, Presque Isle, ME  04769
column5: Worker went into a stacker to clean dust off a photocell eye.  He did not use lockout/tagout, and after the dust was cleared away, the stacker activated.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Miles City Auction Yard Miles City, MT  59301
column5: Worker was trampled by a bull.

Preliminary Description of Incident: United States Infrastructure Corporation, Fort Wayne, IN 46825
column5: Worker was spray painting utility when he was struck by a vehicle. Worker later died on 3/19/2010.
Worker was fatally shot during a robbery and was pronounced dead at the scene.
Two workers were moving an aluminum ladder.  The ladder contacted an overhead power line.  One worker was electrocuted and the other was hospitalized.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Phoenix Fabricators and Erectors, Cleburne, TX  76033
column5: Worker fell from an elevated water tower area.
Worker was working on a motor, contacted live wires and was electrocuted.
Worker was operating a boom on a water well truck, when boom came in contact with overhead power line, electrocuting the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Washington Merchant Patrol, Federal Way, WA 92023
column5: Worker, at the end of fourth day on night shift, drove company car into back of parked trucks. He received multiple head injuries.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Hermann Brothers Logging and Construction, Port Angeles, WA 98362
column5: Worker was sitting on a conveyor and welding, when the conveyor system was energized causing the employee to be crushed. No locks were used to lockout the conveyor system.
Worker was driving a JackRunner chipper. He left the cab of the chipper and got caught in the auger of the JackRabbit bank-out car.
Worker was checking on office of a coworker. The worker opened the window and stepped out on the ledge where he slipped and fell to the parking lot below - approximately 20 - 25 feet.
Three volunteers setting up 40-foot portable antenna for radio communications during bicycle event. Top of antenna swayed 10 feet and touched high voltage line. One killed; one injured.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Anderson Erickson Dairy, De Moines, IA 50317
column5: Worker was attempting to clear a jammed flat of milk product containers when the ram actuator started moving forward, pinning the worker between the actuator and positioning post, crushing the worker.
Worker fell from 15-story building to 6th floor atrium.

Preliminary Description of Incident: JAF Company Telephone Contractor, Yauco, PR 00698
column5: Worker was installing a telephone cable while standing on a fiberglass ladder. He came in contact with a 4,000-Volt electrical line and fell 15 feet to the ground and died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Asplundh Tree Expert Co., Moutheard, KY 41548
column5: Two workers had begun setting up traffic demarcations alongside the highway. The workers were struck by a tractor trailer whose brakes failed.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Coopers Creek Store, Bryson City, NC 28713
column5: Worker complained about not feeling well. He went to the basement of the store where he was running a gasoline powered generator. He was found at the bottom of the stairs. It was reported that carbon monoxide levels in the basement measured greater than 900 parts per million.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Village of Homewood - Fire Department, Homewood, IL 60430
column5: During a rescue attempt at a fully engulfed residential fire, two firefighters were injured and taken to the hospital. One firefighter died from his injuries.
Two workers were cleaning a clogged pipe at the bottom of an enclosed molasses tank and were asphyxiated in the tank.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Michael F. Ronca & Sons, Inc., Nottingham, PA  19362
column5: Worker was performing work on filter galleries of a waste water treatment plant.  Worker appeared to have a heart attack and fell 9 feet to the bottom of the filtering bed, suffering head trauma.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Robinson Drilling of Texas, Ltd., Midland, TX  79701
column5: Worker was on a twelve-foot ladder and tapped on a valve connection from a pump union.  The union struck and destroyed the ladder.  Worker fell and was impaled on debris.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Village of Washington Park, Washington Park, IL 62204
column5: Mayor of the Village of Washington Park was driving through the village at 6 a.m., after leaving his second job. He stopped when someone asked for assistance and was shot twice by someone in a passing car.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Color Star Growers of Colorado, Fort Lupton, CO  80621
column5: Worker was transporting roofing materials and fell from height.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Tesoro Refining & Marketing Company, Anacortes, WA 98221
column5: A naphtha hydrotreater located at a refinery released fuel which ignited.  Five workers died; two were critically injured.

Preliminary Description of Incident: D & P Trucking, Inc., Tucson, AZ 85742
column5: Owner was in the process of cleaning the scissor lift. He raised the lift, making contact with overhead power lines, and was electrocuted.
Worker was performing air conditioning work on the roof a building when he fell 25 feet to the ground.
Worker was walking at a truck stop when he was struck and killed by a tractor trailer.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Penro Construction Company, Inc., Macy, NE  68039
column5: Worker was working on a water line in a trench at a depth of 9 feet.  The wrench he was using slipped off of the bolt and he fell backwards into a deeper trench at a depth of 14 feet and struck his right knee on a cast iron fitting.  Worker had a heart attack/blood clot.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Morgan Builders, Inc., New York, NY  10011
column5: Worker fell down the stairway.
Heavy equipment driver was in the process of stepping down backwards from a low-boy trailer when he fell and hit his head on the asphalt. He never regained consciousness and died 4 days later.
A free-standing masonry wall that was approximately 12 feet long by 22 feet high collapsed, crushing the worker.
Worker was struck by a pickup truck.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Auto Truck Group, Inc., Barlett, IL  60103
column5: Worker was mounting a crane on a truck.  The crane fell and hit the worker.
Worker was installing floor plates on a drilling rig.  The bridal line and equalizer fell to the derrick floor, crushing the worker.
Worker had exited his truck and walked in back of the skidder.  The skidder backed over the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Brian's Professional Cleaning & Restoration Co., Inc., Bethlehem, PA  18015
column5: Worker was remodeling a residential home and fell through a second floor window opening onto a pump jack scaffold and then onto the ground.

Preliminary Description of Incident: JBS United, Inc., Union City, TN 38261

Preliminary Description of Incident: A Bagnoll & Sons, Inc., Hudson, OH  44236
column5: Two workers were working in a trench without trench protection and the trench collapsed.  One worker fatality and one worker was hospitalized.

Worker was instructed to drive the excavator back to the laydown yard.  The excavator boom was elevated and struck a steel girder of an overpass.  This caused the excavator to move to the center lane where it was struck by a tractor trailer.  Worker was ejected from the excavator and was run over by the rear wheels of the tractor trailer.
Worker was sandblasting the bottom of a water tower and fell to the ground.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Delta Timber Co., Inc., Delta, CO  81416
column5: Worker was dislodging lumber from a piece of equipment and another piece of lumber entered the area, crushing the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Modern Painting & Decorating, New Kensington, PA  15068
column5: Worker was positioned on the roof of a building, painting the exterior, using a plastic pole that had an aluminum pole on the inside of the plastic paint stick with a metal roller that was connected to the pole.  The paint roller or pole contacted a high voltage 7,500 Volt energized electric power line.  Worker was electrocuted.
Worker fell from a three story roof onto a concrete walkway.
Worker was installing a roof and fell 20 feet through a skylight, landing on the ground.

Logger was attempting to dislodge a tree that did not fall after it was cut. He attempted to cut another tree to hit the lodged tree. The second tree fell on him. He had worked for the company for one week.
Worker was working on his own vehicle and was pinned by the forks of a forklift and the vehicle.

Preliminary Description of Incident: The Tiger and Elephant Encounter, Wilkes Barre, PA  18704
column5: Worker was kicked by an elephant.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Amitron Corp., Elk Grove Village, IL  60007

column5: Worker walked on the un-barricade or uncovered cut section of a roof decking and fell.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Tioga Fire Co #1, Tioga Center, NY 13734
column5: While responding to an emergency call, worker struck the rear of a recycling truck that was stopped.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Vegas Tunnel Constructors, Boulder City, Clark County, NV

Worker was pulling frozen food boxes for customer orders while standing on a wooden pallet lifted up by a company forklift truck. The forklift operator lowered the forklift, with worker still on pallet, to approximately 10 feet above the concrete floor, and began backing up. Operator heard something fall and found the worker lying face down on the concrete floor.

column5: A naphtha hydrotreater, located at the refinery, released fuel which ignited. Initial count:  five workers died; two were critically injured. Update: one of the critically injured has died.

column5: Worker was found underneath skidder's rear tire, after skidder was pulled into deck.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Pike Electric, Inc, Mount Airy, North Carolina 28719
column5: Worker was thrown from the seat of the digger derrick truck as the boom detached from the truck.

Worker was operating a forklift, pulling pallets from a bin.  He pulled a pallet and the pallet above fell and spilled product on the floor.  He got off the forklift, tripped and slid on the concrete floor, he was knocked out.

column5: Worker was struck by a loader.

Worker was in the process of replacing a line and collapsed.  Not sure of heart attack or electrocution.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Cub Foods Mankato West, Mankato, MN 56001

Worker was repairing a hose on a hydraulic dock plate and the dock plate fell on the worker.

Worker was to determine why a boom section of a concrete pumping truck would not retract.  A bolt on the holding valve was loosened and nearly removed, high pressure hydraulic fluid blew the valve and bolt from the cylinder, striking the worker who was sitting in the boom.
Worker installing electrical wiring in a false ceiling, fell from ladder.
