Two workers were using a plasma cutter to cut a sheet of metal while the metal was sitting on two empty drums of hydraulic fluid. The workers cut into one of the barrels resulting in an explosion/fire. One worker sustained burns to the upper part of this body and face. The other worker sustained fractures and shrapnel wounds.  One fatality.
Worker sustained fatal injuries after falling 10 to 15 feet from a beam, landing on his head.
The worker was crushed between garage door frame and machine he was attempting to move into the garage resulting in fatal injury.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Clark County Ambulance Service West Union, IL  62477
column5: Two EMTs suffered fatal injuries in a motor vehicle accident when their ambulance was struck by another vehicle whose diver ran a stop sign.
Worker backed his truck to dump a load of CA6/Roadmix; the truck was in a jackknifed position. As the dump was raised he truck tipped over crushing the cab of the truck.

The worker fell and broke her hip. The worker subsequently had a surgery for her broken hip, and had been in a rehabilitation home for four to five weeks. The worker's son stated that the death could possibly be due to a complication from the surgery.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Ocean Point Condo, Miami Beach, FL 33139
column5: The worker was attempting to repair an elevator when he got caught in between the elevator and adjacent wall resulting in the worker dying of crushing injuries.
The worker was on his 5th day training to be a rail switchman. The other members lost contact with him, when he was located, he was found laying next to the rail, with fatal injuries.
The worker was working alone on a ladder installing piping in preparation for start-up. The worker was found on the ground nonresponsive.
An employee was operating a palletizer when apparently he climbed into the machine to un-jam a pallet and was crushed.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Ron Perrin Water Technologies, Richmond, TX  77469
column5: Worker was conducting cleaning operations within a 500,000-gallon aboveground water tank, and drowned.

Two employees were conducting demolition operations and a piece of rebar was lodged in the concrete. Employee 1 used the Bobcat hammer and began hammering the area near the rebar, the vibrations caused the rebar to come free from Employee 2 hand, the rebar struck him in the head, causing serious damage to his cranium.
Worker was working from a bucket truck, pulling wire.  An oncoming truck snagged the wire and pulled the worker from the bucket truck.
Worker rolled backhoe into river.
Worker was walking behind a dump truck and was run over by the truck.
A coconut tree trimmer suffered fatal injuries after getting caught in his body harness.
Worker was accessing a side kit door of tractor trailer semi and lost grip on handrails; falling backwards, hit back of head on concrete floor.
Worker was riding in golf cart.  He stepped out while it was still moving, fell, and hit his head.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Mililani Group Inc dba Mililani Memorial Park,   Waipahu, HI 96797
column5: Worker was operating a front-end loader with backhoe attachment when he lost control on a 40- to 60-degree slope. The tractor flipped onto its left side, fatally pinning the worker under the cab's roof area.  No seat belt was found on the tractor.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Merced County Board of Education, Merced, CA 95343
column5: Worker traveling to client's home, when another person in another vehicle drove into a tractor trailer.  The truck hit the worker's car, resulting in fatal injuries.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Welding Industrial Supply Company,, Chicago, IL 60643
column5: While delivering compressed gas cylinders, worker collapsed from compressive asphyxia; cause unknown.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Eun Construction, Inc, Mount Holly NC 28120
column5: The roof section of a screened porch fell and struck the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Ambhar Lounge Tropicana Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV 89109
column5: Worker was dusting decorative molding when he fell approximately eight feet to the floor, resulting in blunt force trauma to his head.  (This was a possible diabetic episode; the coroner is investigating.)

Preliminary Description of Incident: California Department of Mental Health, Napa, CA  94558
column5: Worker was on her dinner break. She did not return and was found dead on the grounds at 6:10 p.m.  A patient was arrested by Napa County Sheriff's Office and is being held in corrections with the fatal incident.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Greg's Marine Construction, Inc.,, Lusby, MD 20657
column5: During a demolition operation, worker was attached into a pylon splash jacket that slipped down the pylon and pulled the worker 50 feet underwater.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Ayalaz Agriculture Services FLC #12004, Kettleman City, CA 93239
column5: Worker was crushed when tractor he was driving, pulling a bin dumper full of pomegranates, fell onto its side.  Worker was possibly trying to make a U-turn while going too fast.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Labor Only Re-Cover, Inc.,, Berlin, NJ 08009
column5: Worker was walking across roof and fell through the roof to the floor.
While roofing, worker fell from pitched roof of residence.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Gulf-Atlantic Constructors, Inc.,, Gulf Breeze , FL 32563
column5: Worker was placing highway safety barrels for a lane closure.  An on-coming car swerved into the closed lane and struck him.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Family Ranch, Inc., Kettleman City, CA 93239
column5: Worker was using an auger to drive posts into the ground, when his clothing became entangled in the equipment resulting in fatal injuries.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Post Buckley Schuh & Jerngan Inc.,, Houston, TX 77032
column5: While walking along track, worker was struck by unmanned rail car at airport.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Don Park (USA) Limited Partnership,, Conley, GA 30288
column5: While worker was attempting to guide a steel beam structure being moved by a crane and a forklift, the structure tilted and crushed worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Notre Dame University, Notre Dame, IN  46556
column5: Worker was in a scissor lift filming a football practice when the lift tipped over.  (High winds were reported.)
Worker was caught between a powered industrial truck and a railroad car and was crushed.
Roofer fell head first from roof to concrete below.
While working on the exterior of a bin deck of a grain elevator, worker fell approximately 93 feet to the ground.
Worker fell from lift.

Preliminary Description of Incident: County of Bernalillo Sheriff's Department,  Albuquerque, NM 87109
column5: Sheriff's Deputy was killed after the patrol motorcycle that he was riding was struck by a truck that crossed the median.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Pennell & Marlowe Land Surveyors,, Midland, TX 79705
column5: Worker was changing the tire on a company truck using a small mechanical jack to lift the truck.  The truck slipped off the jack and fell onto worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Busan Nissan Motor Sales,, Cincinnati, OH 45246
column5: Worker fell, striking his head, while window washing from a ladder/ scaffold.
Workers were on a metal roof when the roof gave way and collapsed due to deterioration.  One worker fell through the roof.
Worker had installed a liquid nitrogen jacket around the outside of the conductor pipe and was flowing liquid nitrogen in order to form a plug.  Worker was found collapsed.
Worker was crushed when masonry portico fell from foundation wall into the trench where the worker was working.

Preliminary Description of Incident: L. H. Woods & Sons, Colton, CA  92324
column5: Worker was crushed between two pieces of steel K-rails.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Mike S Foy Stucco LLC,, Bradenton, FL 34208
column5: Worker was on a residential roof over a pool deck doing stucco work on a chimney.  Worker lost his footing at the edge of the roof, fell through the pool screen, and struck his head on the concrete pool decking, sustaining head trauma.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Travel Centers of America,, Brunswick, GA 31523
column5: Worker was replacing a tire on a tractor trailer when the vehicle fell off the jacks and crushed the worker underneath.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Meade Electric Co. Inc.,, Rock Island, IL 61201
column5: Worker was loading a backhoe onto a low-boy trailer when the backhoe tipped over, fell off the trailer, and crushed the worker underneath the cab.
Worker was pinned under truck during work at a rural site.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Precision Construction & Maintenance, LLC,, Metairie, LA 70119
column5: While excavator was lifting a mat, a chain broke and worker was crushed underneath.

Two workers were framing on roof of building 30 feet above ground level, when one fell over the side of the building onto the concrete sidewalk below.  He had been walking backwards moving a 2x6 piece of lumber.
Worker was cutting a tree down.  As tree fell, a branch broke off and struck worker.
Worker was riding on top of plywood that was on the forks of a rough terrain forklift.  Worker fell off the plywood and was run over by the forklift.
Forklift, rigged with telescoping boom, was lowering approximately 3,000 lbs. of rebar into excavated area.  Boom failed, tipping the forklift and causing it to roll onto and crush the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Adecco, York, PA 17402, Juan C. Parada,
column5: While flagging traffic, worker was struck by a vehicle he was directing to a different lane.
Worker was electrocuted when ladder contacted overhead electrical lines.

Preliminary Description of Incident: MFA Agri Services,, St. Joseph, MO 64501
column5: After worker attached an ammonia nurse tank to a customer's pickup truck, the truck began to roll.  Customer jumped into truck and hit the wrong pedal.  Truck accelerated and pinned worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Tri City Wastepaper, Inc., Kingsport, TN 37660
column5: Worker, attempting to load a forklift onto a flatbed trailer, suffered fatal injuries after a ramp dropped onto him.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Double U Livestock, Cherry Creek , NV 89301
column5: Worker who was attempting to jump start a farm tractor, suffered massive trauma to upper torso when pinned between tractor and vehicle.
Worker was caught in flash fire at a chemical plant and died a month later during his burn recovery.
Worker was working from a parked blood-mobile bus.  Worker was standing near the steps at the front of the bus when she fell out of the bus and fatally hit her head on the curb.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Contra Costa County Sheriff Department/Jail, Martinez, CA  94533
column5: County jail worker (a nurse) suffered fatal injuries after being struck in the head by an inmate wielding a lamp. She fell, striking her head on floor.
Worker, who was unstrapping a double-stacked load from a tractor trailer, was killed when 17 boards of unfinished wood became unstable and fell on him.

Preliminary Description of Incident: SSA Marine DBA SSA Terminals (Long Beach) LLC.,, Long Beach, CA  90813
column5: Two workers were operating utility tractor rigs (UTRs) moving shipping containers on the dock.  One operator failed to yield the right of way at an intersection, striking the other UTR.   The impact threw the first operator through the front window of the UTR, which continued to move forward and rolled over him.
Worker died after being pinned between his service truck and a semi-trailer when the service truck was hit by another vehicle.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Jackson Township Fire Department, Helmsburg, IN  47435
column5: Worker was pinned against a wall when the truck response vehicle he was working on rolled forward.
Worker was standing on the lifted forks of a fork truck to repair a down-spout on a grain bin.  Worker lost balance and fell approximately 6 feet, striking his head on the concrete pavement.

Worker at recycling center was operating a forklift with a scoop attached to the forks.  Operator remained in the vehicle while maintenance worker partially removed damaged bolt holding the hydraulic piston to the scoop and walked away to get additional tools.  Operator became pinned between the scoop and the mast of the forklift.
While worker was installing underground power cable, when the digging apparatus struck a buried gas line.  Worker was killed by a natural gas compressed-gas concussion.
An 18-wheeler backed up and ran over two workers who were standing behind the truck.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Rose Brother's Paving Company, Inc., Bath, NC 27808
column5: Worker, a roller operator, walked away from his equipment and  was run over by a dump truck backing out into an open lane.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Seven Valleys Concrete, LLC.,, Centerton, AR 72719
column5: While finishing poured concrete with a broom, the handle extension of the broom contacted an overhead electrical line when the worker lifted the broom to reposition it.
Worker died while performing hot work on top of a 10,000-gallon chemical storage tank that exploded.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Schwab Dairy Farm LLC.,, Delevan, NY 14042
column5: Worker entered a manure spreader and was overcome by methane gas.
While unloading a tanker truck containing lighter fluid, worker began gasping for air.  Although treated with oxygen, worker later died at the hospital.
While lifting a dumpster on the back of the garbage truck, the truck's locking mechanism apparently failed, causing the dumpster to fall and strike worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Wagram Paper Stock, Inc., Wagram, NC  28396
column5: Worker was run over by a forklift in an area where forklifts were moving bales of paper.  Worker may have tripped and fallen before being run over.
Mechanical lift rolled over and crushed worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: F. Miller Construction, LLC.,, Grand Isle, LA 70358
column5: A pile of lead fell and struck worker on the torso and head.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Lassen Forest Products, Red Bluff, CA  96080
column5: Worker fell into a wood chipper.
Worker fell from a catwalk used to assist in loading trucks with livestock feed.  Worker fatally struck his head when he impacted the ground.

While workers were repairing a flat roof that had gravel on it, the gravel was collected into sandbags.  One bag, with rope and hook still attached, fell off roof without any resistance and fatally struck a worker in the head.
Worker was cutting down a dead tree which fell against another tree.  The second tree broke off and struck the victim on the head

Preliminary Description of Incident: Pioneer Contracting Co. Inc.,, Baltimore, MD 21224
column5: Worker died after falling 23 feet onto two concrete pipes while trying to cross a Jersey wall along an elevated highway ramp.

Preliminary Description of Incident: McLaughlin Electric Company, Fort Washington, MD  20744
column5: Worker died after being pinned between parked trailer and truck.
Worker was on a roof changing air conditioner filters when he fell through a skylight and landed 17 feet below onto a lower level.

Preliminary Description of Incident: United Sheet Metal, Inc.,, Baltimore, MD 21231
column5: Worker fell 8 feet from a stepladder onto the concrete floor below.

Preliminary Description of Incident: R.H. Fewster Painting Co., Inc., Baltimore, MD 21210
column5: Worker fell off a slate roof while painting a cornice.
Three workers were burned in a flash fire in a blending vat.  One of the injured workers, hospitalized with burns over 45% of his body, passed away a few weeks later.
Workers were setting structural steel and decking on top of cinder block walls.  When a second bundle of decking was placed on unsecured joists, the joists rolled and fell on the victim.
Two workers, picking up litter on a median strip, were both struck and killed by a highway vehicle which left the road.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Empire Distributors of North Carolina, Inc.,, Charlotte, NC 28273
column5: Worker died after falling 12 to 15 feet to the concrete floor from an aerial work platform used for picking orders.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Gibson Logging Enterprises Inc, Holmes Mill, KY 40843
column5: Worker suffered fatal injuries after being struck while cutting timber on a steep slope.

A water line ditch approximately 7 feet deep caved in on a worker as he was installing a tracer wire.  Preliminary investigation suggests that no cave-in protection was in use at the time of the incident.
The worker fell from an undetermined height.
Worker fell from a ladder while caulking a window on a residential structure.
Worker was struck by a tree while cutting down an adjacent tree.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Mountain States Contractors, LLC.,, Memphis TN 37501
column5: Worker drowned after falling into a river when the guardrail system that the employee was tied to was struck by a hammer that fell from a crane bucket.
Worker went through a skylight and fell approximately 40 feet to the floor.
Worker was struck and killed by a tree falling from a dump truck.
Traffic control worker struck by drunk driver while working traffic patrol on the highway.

Preliminary Description of Incident: John Charles Traverso dba Traverso Tree Service,, Concord, CA  94521
column5: Worker died after being partially pulled into a wood chipper. Foot/ankle got caught in rope and pulled him in. Died from head injury when his head hit the gate on the chute. No contact with blades.
While road painting, worker was killed when the vehicle he was working from was struck by a passing tank truck.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Advocate Condell Medical Center,, Libertyville, IL 60048
column5: Maintenance worker went into an area under construction for an unknown reason.  Lead-lined drywall fell onto the worker when he tried to move the cart it was on.

Worker was standing by at a well platform while circulation and cleaning was being performed in the well.  A tube rushed up and out of the well.  As everyone ran for cover, a portion of the tube struck the worker in the head and killed him.
While letting a truck down from his wrecker, worker was caught and crushed between the two vehicles.

Preliminary Description of Incident: McKinney Drilling Company, Inc.,, Kearneysville, WV 25213
column5: Worker was operating a drilling rig.  He was crushed when the rig platform broke and fell on top of him.
Potential carbon monoxide poisoning: worker was found dead in the sleeper berth of a locked tractor trailer.

Preliminary Description of Incident: American Food Service, Santa Clara, CA 95051
column5: Worker died of acute exposure to carbon monoxide while using a gas-powered pressure washer inside a freezer.
Worker who was picking concrete boulders out of a hole, was run over by a frontend loader that backed up over him.

Preliminary Description of Incident: TLC Exteriors, LLC.,, South Hadley, MA 01075
column5: While erecting scaffolding, worker fell approximately 30 feet to the ground.
Worker reached out of loader to retrieve tool while loader's bucket was elevated.  The bucket fell, struck the worker's head, and trapped the worker between it and the loader.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Western States Fire Protection Co.,, Austin, TX 78713
column5: Worker was painting pipe when he fell off an eight-foot ladder and fatally struck his head.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Midwest Auto Transport Inc.,, Clyde, OH 43410
column5: Wheel assembly exploded, fatally striking employee.

Preliminary Description of Incident: American Fireworks Mfg Co. Inc.,, Utica, NY 13502
column5: Worker was struck by fireworks during a fireworks show.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Ledoux Control Systems,, New Orleans, LA 70112
column5: Workers were pulling cable between two rooms.  Two workers found the third worker, who had been working alone, unconscious.  Worker was later pronounced dead at hospital.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Wolf Creek Ski Lodge,, Pagosa Springs, CO 81147
column5: Ski patrol employee was killed in an avalanche.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Baxter Healthcare Corporation,, Cherry Hill, NJ 08003
column5: The worker collapsed and died in the locker room.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Melton Truck Lines,, Eau Claire, WI 54703
column5: Truck driver picked up a load of insulation and began covering the load with tarp.  Driver was later found dead on top of the load and underneath the tarp.  Cause of death currently unknown.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Patterson UTI Drilling Co., LLC, Rig 520,, Cotulla, TX 78014
column5: While workers were rigging up a drill rig, the bottom came loose when the crew picked up the rig.  The bottom swung free and fatally struck an employee.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Prestige Security Inc,, Coral Springs, FL 33065
column5: The worker tripped on a median curb, fell backwards and struck his head on a car.
Worker was electrocuted while attempting to reposition an aluminum ladder.  The ladder created an arc from the overhead lines.  Second employee was hospitalized.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Harsco Metals ARI, LLC,, Ghent, KY  41045
column5: One worker was killed and 5 others injured, one critically, when the workers were removing a chain from a tire on a front-end loader and the tire exploded.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Searcy Healthcare Center, LLC,, Searcy, AR  72143
column5: Worker was hanging curtains and fell from a ladder.
While delivering mail, worker lost consciousness and hit a parked car.  Cardiac arrest likely.
Worker fell 12 feet from the edge of a roof while in the process of measuring and marking metal panels for installation. During the fall, the victim stuck both a stairwell and handrail.
A worker servicing a vehicle was run over when a co-worker moved the vehicle.
Worker found on floor, after apparent fall from ladder; ladder may have been damaged.
A Chicago police officer was shot and killed while processing the scene of a burglary inside a garage.
Worker was caught between a gate and a building, while herding cows into a barn for milking.
Worker was engaged in cleaning debris from a 60-inch storm sewer pipe and collapsed from health issues.
Worker was struck by a semi-truck as he was walking across a parking lot.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Trinity Marine Products Inc.,, Ashland City, TN  37015
column5: Worker was crushed by a metal frame that fell and struck him.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Advanced Imaging Technologies,, West Yarmouth , MA 02673
column5: Worker fell from a 9-foot high unguarded mezzanine while working.
Worker was found crushed between the conveyor belt and roller.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Mille Lacs Band of Ojibwe,, Onamia, MN 56359
column5: Worker was found unresponsive at his vehicle in a parking lot, outside the casino, where he worked; possible heart disease.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Peconic Land Trust Inc,, Amagansett, NY 11930
column5: Worker was crushed by a tractor.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Burlington Northern Santa Fe,, Superior, WI 54880
column5: Worker was working on an elevated catwalk of a material handling system, and was caught between the material chute and the framework of a  moving shuttle conveyor.
Worker was working alone on an elevator when he was trapped between an elevator car and a fixed ladder and was crushed.

A lift truck backed into a scissor lift that was being operated by two employees. The scissor lift tipped forward and fell to the ground. Both workers were taken to the hospital, where one worker died.

Preliminary Description of Incident: C & C Construction & Floor Covering, Inc.,, Junction City, KS  66441
column5: Worker was working on a new construction residence and fell from a ladder.
Worker was approaching a semi-trailer to open the trailer doors and was struck by a straight truck, pinning him against the semi-trailer.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Putnam and Sons Trucking,, Towanda, PA  18848
column5: Worker was struck by a vehicle.
Worker was installing new hinges on the doors of an electrical transformer and contacted an energized conductor inside.
Worker was conducting repairs on a milling machine, which was not locked out.  The machine started, crushing the worker.

Worker was operating a stand-up type, reach-rider, high-lift truck in reverse when he struck an empty wooden pallet positioned on the forks of an unmanned reach-rider truck.  The worker contacted the pallet with his upper chest and the force lifted him off the deck of the operator's position and crushed him against the vertical boom of the lift.  Worker was operating both forklifts in performance of his job.
Worker was pulling the rubber roofing and fell 15 to 20 feet through a skylight.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Sharps Mill Forest Products, Inc.,, Palmyra, TN 37142
column5: Worker was felling trees in a tract with vines intertwined among the trees when one tree uprooted another, which struck and killed the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: State Armory NYS Div Military & Naval Affairs, New York, NY 11433
column5: Worker was putting a tarp on a leaky roof when he lost his footing, falling about 60 feet through a glass skylight.
Worker was installing heating and cooling equipment and fell from a ladder.
Worker died after receiving multiple bee stings while working outside an apartment building.

Preliminary Description of Incident: G & M Metals, Inc.,, Wood Dale, IL  60191
column5: Worker was inside a baler performing maintenance or troubleshooting and was crushed by the ram.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Kramer Tree Specialists, Incorporated,, Chicago, IL 60804
column5: Worker during felling operations of a wood communication pole was struck by the pole.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Snelson Companies Inc.,, Green River, WY 82935
column5: Worker was welding two pieces of pipe when one of the pieces shifted, striking and fatally injuring him.
Worker was changing the left front tire of a semi truck with a trailer attached when the jack slipped, causing the truck to fall, crushing his head.
Worker was dismantling an outrigger from a bridge, using a bucket truck, and fell 38 feet to the ground.
Worker was performing decking work at a height of 30-35 feet above ground level and fell through the decking.

Worker was struck by pipe that was being lowered into an excavation by a side-boom pipe layer, causing him to fall into the excavation. The pipe, consisting of 10 sections of 80-foot pipe that were welded together, then fell on top of him.
Worker fell two and a half stories from a scaffold, striking his head on a pillar below.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Gulf Stream Marine, Inc.,, Houston, TX  77015
column5: Worker was conducting checker activities at the unloading area.  The driver pulled the tractor trailer forward, causing the worker to fall down under the path of the trailer wheels.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Proctor & Associates, Inc.,, Richmond Hill, GA  31324
column5: Worker was setting steel bar joists on a concrete-block wall and was knocked off the wall.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Tyson Foods, Inc., Nashville Feed Mill,, Nashville, AR  71852
column5: Worker was working at a grain bin.   The grain bin collapsed.

Preliminary Description of Incident: West Penn Energy Services llc Inc.,, Sherocta, PA  15774
column5: Worker was heating a valve on the rear of a water truck with a propane torch and an explosion occurred.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Bob Davis Paint & Drywall, Inc.,, Galveston, TX 77554
column5: Worker was operating an aerial lift to perform painting on a 4-story condominium, when he was pinned between the building and the control station in the elevated working platform.  His body pushed against the joystick that controlled the lift, causing it to push him even more against the building, which eventually caused his death.

Preliminary Description of Incident: S. Digregorio & Son, Inc.,, Silver Spring, MD 20910
column5: Worker was found under an overhead door.
Worker fell from lower level while installing asphalt roof shingles.
Bulldozer operator was backing down a slope preparing for seeding. Bulldozer flipped over twice and worker was ejected after hitting his head on dash.

Worker fell from a vertical staircase located in the locker room. She cut her lip and was taken to the medical room, where she later passed out in the chair. She was rushed to the emergency room, where she was pronounced dead.
The drilling rig crew was making a connection, when a worker threw a chain over his shoulder. The chain wrapped around the line going into the drum, and the worker was pulled into the draw works.
Worker fell into the Mississippi River under the barge he was working on. He was admitted to a hospital, where he later died.
Worker was stepping out of his vehicle and fell over onto the ground.
A 15- to 20-foot trench collapsed on two workers who were inside helping to move storm drain pipes.
Worker suffered fatal injuries when he fell from a second floor area, which was not equipped with guardrails or fall protection, to the floor of the foyer below.
Owner of an excavating company performing forestry operations was killed after being struck by a falling branch.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Marshall Durbin Food Corp,, Hattiesburg, MS 39401
column5: Worker was picking up trash on the side of the access road and stepped in front of a truck.
Worker was fatally injured while working on a grease recovery platform. Worker was attempting to use a boom pipe to fill a tanker truck with grease and collapsed on the platform.
Worker was walking behind the company utility truck as it was backing up, and worker was struck by a truck.

Preliminary Description of Incident: L Kenneth Hinkle & Son,, Quakertown, PA 18951
column5: The worker was struck by a backing trash collection vehicle.

Preliminary Description of Incident: T.W.A. Express LLC,, St. Louis, MO 63147
column5: The worker was underneath his assigned truck possibly attempting to separate the tractor from its trailer. The trailer collapsed unexpectedly striking the worker in the head.

Preliminary Description of Incident: All Catastrophe Construction Team,, Macon, GA 31238
column5: Worker was standing on the concrete crusher when another employee operating a track hoe mistakenly hit the victim, causing him to fall to the ground.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Asplundh Tree Expert Company,, Trenton, OH 45067
column5: Worker was walking across a single train track trestle bridge and was struck by the train.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Lewis Construction INC,, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729
column5: Worker was pouring concrete into forms. The form system failed, crushing the worker.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Pearl Harbor Naval Shipyard,, Pearl Harbor, HI 96860
column5: Worker was a passenger on an electric motor cart, not wearing his seat belt, and was ejected from the vehicle when the driver lost control.

Preliminary Description of Incident: George Jones Excavating LLC,, East Cape Girardeau, IL 62957
column5: A section of concrete road collapsed; one worker died.
Worker was struck by a falling tree.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Sloan Implement Co. Inc,, Carlinville, IL 62626
column5: Worker was loading a mobile sprayer onto a lowboy trailer. As the sprayer was driven on, it rolled off and the worker was crushed by a wheel of the sprayer. The trailer's outriggers were not out/set.
Worker was conducting overhaul work in a power plant when he fell 20 feet through a floor opening.
Worker was remodeling the first floor of a building and fell from a 6-foot ladder.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Kanaflex Corporation of Illinois,, Vernon Hills, IL 60061
column5: Worker fell 23 feet through a skylight on a roof.

Worker was working on the front of a bulldozer.  Another worker was backing up a backhoe to attach chains to the bulldozer, and did not see the first worker, who was then caught between the backhoe and bulldozer.
Worker was run over by a 6-wheel spotter used to move trailers around the yard.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Allen Jay Elementary School,, High Point, NC 27265
column5: Worker died nearly a week after falling in a school parking lot and injuring her foot.
Two firefighters died and 14 were hospitalized after a wall collapsed on them as they were extinguishing a fire in an abandoned warehouse.

Preliminary Description of Incident: John Benward Company, Inc.,, East Sonoma, CA 95476
column5: Worker was caught between a stationary skid steer and a dump truck moving in reverse.
Worker was delivering propane to a customer. The truck began to move and the worker was crushed between the truck and the building.
While working in a 15 to 20 feet deep trench, the walls collapsed, burying two workers. One worker was rescued and hospitalized, but the other worker was buried completely and died.
Worker was installing recessed light fixtures and fell from an 8-foot ladder.

Preliminary Description of Incident: KE & G Construction, Inc.,, Sierra Vista, AZ 85635
column5: Worker in trench was struck after a manhole section broke free of a lifting device and fell 15 feet back into the trench.

Preliminary Description of Incident: Honey Creek Disposal Services,, Lawrence, KS 66044
column5: Worker was run over by a refuse truck.
